body: What would you expect the correct behaviour to be?

Not a spew of errors in the console and the puller being paused, that's for sure! (I encountered this while trying to delete quite a large tree, with lots of ignored .git dirs). I think graceful detection of the situation so as not to trigger slightly unclear errors, and not pause the puller, is the most important thing. After that, a message saying "we tried to delete this folder but there was an ignored file/folder in it so we couldn't. Please remove it yourself" in the gui would be nice, and adding a button to delete the folder anyway would be ideal (although a fair bit more work I'm sure). Thanks!

It's probably also worth mentioning that if you have `A/B/C/D/E/IgnoredFile`, then Syncthing will try and fail to delete `A/B/C/D/E`, then try and fail to delete `A/B/C/D`, and so on. So if the ignored file is a few directories deep, the errors quickly add up.

Yeah this whole ignore stuff should get replaced with selective sync, which will then give you better control and mitigate these sort of issues.
It will be per directory though.
Ah ok, so this is wontfix until selective sync comes in? Fair enough. Do you have a rough timescale for that?
No. :) The errors are for sure not graceful, but on the other hand we need to say something since we're failing to sync to the wanted stated.
This is an old, known (by me at least) issue and I was sure there was already a ticket for it. I can't find one though, so letting this one live. :)

Yeah, I had a good search around and couldn't find another mention of this specific issue anywhere.

The large number of culmutative errors (especially if the ignored file is buried deep in a directory hierarchy) does mean that the puller keeps being stopped, and it looks to the casual eye that everything's fallen apart (rather than it being an easily resolvable problem).
I am having the same problem.
I have a similar problem when I ignore a directory. No files are syncronized an but empty directory is created on the other node. :(
To ignore a directory (and not it's content), make sure that the pattern does not end with a `/`, as `/` assumes the content of it and not the directory itself.

issue.title: Cannot delete directories if it contains ignored files

labels.name: bug
labels.description: A problem with current functionality, as opposed to missing functionality (enhancement)

labels.name: frozen-due-to-age
labels.description: Issues closed and untouched for a long time, together with being locked for discussion

issue.body:
Whenever I delete a folder from a repo, just, like, get rid of it completely, I'll get a puller error on other peers. It complains about being unable to delete directories because they're not empty.

```
[X6IU7] 20:54:17 INFO: Puller (folder "School", dir "CIT383/Labs/mcpheronw1-lab17/ruby-1.8.6/lib/soap"): delete: remove /home/trent/School/CIT383/Labs/mcpheronw1-lab17/ruby-1.8.6/lib/soap: directory not empty
[X6IU7] 20:54:17 INFO: Puller (folder "School", dir "CIT383/Labs/mcpheronw1-lab17/ruby-1.8.6/lib"): delete: remove /home/trent/School/CIT383/Labs/mcpheronw1-lab17/ruby-1.8.6/lib: directory not empty
[X6IU7] 20:54:17 INFO: Puller (folder "School", dir "CIT383/Labs/mcpheronw1-lab17/ruby-1.8.6"): delete: remove /home/trent/School/CIT383/Labs/mcpheronw1-lab17/ruby-1.8.6: directory not empty
[X6IU7] 20:54:17 INFO: Puller (folder "School", dir "CIT383/Labs/mcpheronw1-lab17"): delete: remove /home/trent/School/CIT383/Labs/mcpheronw1-lab17: directory not empty
[X6IU7] 20:54:17 INFO: Puller (folder "School", dir "CIT383/Labs"): delete: remove /home/trent/School/CIT383/Labs: directory not empty
[X6IU7] 20:54:17 INFO: Puller (folder "School", dir "CIT383"): delete: remove /home/trent/School/CIT383: directory not empty
```

Eventually, the error resolves itself for no discernible reason, but it's kind of annoying to see it happen at all.

Running Syncthing 0.11.3 through Syncthing-GTK 0.7.0.2 on Linux 64-bit.

issue.title: Add (?d) ignore prefix, allowing them to be deleted

labels.name: frozen-due-to-age
labels.description: Issues closed and untouched for a long time, together with being locked for discussion

issue.body:
### Purpose

Adds a (?d) prefix which marks the file as deletable, so that when we are deleting a directory, we can delete anything that is ignored and in our way.

Also, removes the need to specify the prefixes in a certain order.
### Testing

Users will tell me if I deleted all of their photos
### Screenshots

![](http://integral-integrity.info/DRimages/pic_computerdisaster.jpg)
### Documentation

Need some

issue.title: SyncTrayzor.Bootstrapper: An unhandled AppDomain exception occurred. Terminating: True System.InvalidOperationException Synchronized value is null T GetAsserted()

repository.name: SyncTrayzor
repository.description: Windows tray utility / filesystem watcher / launcher for Syncthing

issue.body:
Hi,

Had a crash this morning of Synctrayzor, thought I would post the log in case there was anything to be found.  Its a bit odd though as we were definitely interacting with the syncthing web interface past the time of the crash and watching it update files, however the logs for both stop at the same time,

Here is the windows log:

the repeat delete actions are due to [syncthing issue 1362](https://github.com/syncthing/syncthing/issues/1362) (we have ignored thumbs.db and desktop.ini which prevent folders being deleted but is fixed in 0.13)

